page.title: 02QUARRY NEAR WOMERSLEY.
page.content: The quarry has been open since the early 1970's. There are many types of stone been quarried, the main two being Permian Limestone and Yorkshire Stone.The stone is excavated out of the ground as explosives are too dangerous to use.The types of machinery used for taking stone out of the ground are bulldozers, face shovels, and drills. From Sep-84 to Sep-85 approximately 150,000 tonnes of stone were excavated. The present rate of excavating has increased to 800 tonnes per day ( 280,000 per year), giving the quarry a total life span of about another 3 years. The stone is cut and sold to building contractors all over yorkshire. The quarry employs 20 men, 18 of them live in Doncaster and 2 in Knaresborough.
